preqs: Students must have passed one of the following units: AFF1300, BFF1300, BFB1001, BFC1001, BFF1001, BFP1001 or BFW1001

rules.ruleString: Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {AFF1300, BFB1001, BFC1001, BFF1001, BFF1300, BFP1001, BFW1001} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
Unit was previously coded {AFF2401%, AFW2401%, BFF2401, DEB240, DEB2401%, FIN240, FIN2401}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {AFC3170, AFW2401, BFC3170, BFW2401}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {AFC3170, AFW2401, BFC3170, BFW2401}
Unit was previously coded {AFF2401%, AFW2401%, BFF2401, DEB240, DEB2401%, FIN240, FIN2401}
Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {AFF1300, BFB1300, BFC2000, BFF1001, BFF1300, BFG1300, BFW1300} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}

description: This unit examines the major risks and issues faced by Australian financial institutions within the context of the global environment. Topics include an introduction to the Australian banking environment, bank performance, management of bank risks including credit, capital, liquidity and interest rate risk, loan pricing, liability management, investment management and capital adequacy.
